column3:
Luke takes his dog for a walk. Luke has many pets. He has a turtle named Bob. He has a cat
ewlinenamed Freckles. He has a bird named squeaky. The dog is named Sparky. Sparky loves to go
ewlineon walks with Luke. Sparky jumps around in front of the doorway.  Luke puts on his hat,
ewlinecoat, and gloves because it is chilly outside. Luke puts a leash around Sparky's
ewlineneck. Luke opens the door and they are ready to go. Luke walks up Vine Street to the stop
ewlinesign. The stop sign is red. Luke looks both ways and then walks across Willow street with
ewlineSparky. Luke and Sparky walk up the hill.  At the top of the hill, Luke and Sparky turn
ewlineleft. They walk downhill on First Street. At the bottom of the hill, they see a small
ewlinepond. The pond is on Elm Street. Sparky is very happy. Swimming in the pond are
ewlineducks. There are white ducks and brown ducks. There are baby ducks, too. Sparky walks all
ewlinearound the pond. Luke watches the ducks as they swim around the pond. When it is time to
ewlinego, Luke leads Sparky back to the sidewalk. It is warmer and Luke takes off his hat and
ewlinecoat. They walk home.
column4: one: What is Luke's dog named?
column9: one: The pond is on which street?
column14: multiple: What actions does Luke take in this story?
column15: He puts on his hat, coat and gloves, and leaves all of them on through the whole story.
column16: He puts on his hat, coat, and gloves, but takes them off before going to the pond.
column17: He put on his hat, coat and gloves, but later takes off his hat and coat.
column18: He puts on his hat, coat, and gloves, but later takes off only his gloves.
column19: multiple: What path do Luke and Sparky take to the pond?
column20: They stay on Vine Street the whole way.
column21: Across First Street and taking a left turn to Elm Street.
column22: Down Vine Street, across Willow Street, turning on First Street to Elm Street.
column23: Down Elm Street, to Willow Street, Turning on Vine Street, to First Street.
